bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this Act:

bcl:text.#text: means 2 or more licences that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
are listed in an item of the Schedule under a group name
              assigned to them in Column 1 of that item, and
are each identified by licence number in Column 2 of that item;

bcl:text.#text: means a licence that is replaceable under the  and is a

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: forest licence,
tree farm licence, or
timber sale licence;

bcl:text.#text: means a timber licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
that describes an area of Crown land that is not in a tree farm licence area,
              and

is held by a person who is the holder of a licence in a group of
              licences;

bcl:text.#text: means a licence that is

bcl:text: but does not include a licence in a group of licences.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
mentioned in an item of the Schedule separately from other
              licences, and
identified by licence number in Column 2 of that item

bcl:text.#text:
Words and expressions used in this Act but not defined in subsection (1) or in a
          regulation under section 13 (2) (a) have the same meanings as in the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tree farm licence — allowable annual cut defined

bcl:text.#text:
For the purposes of sections 2 (3) and 3 (3),  in relation to a tree farm licence in a group of licences means the
        allowable annual cut available to its holder.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Harvesting rights reduced for timber licences and certain replaceable
        licences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The allowable annual cut of an ungrouped licence identified in an item of the
            Schedule is reduced by the amount specified in Column 3 of that
          item.

Each area of Crown land described in a timber licence is reduced by
          20%.

The total of the allowable annual cuts of the licences in a group of licences
          listed in an item of the Schedule is reduced by the amount specified in Column 3
          of that item opposite the group name, assigned in Column 1, under which the licences are
          listed.
By one or more orders in writing, the minister

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
must attribute a reduction in area under section 2 (2) in equal or unequal
            portions, specified in the order, to one or more of the timber licences held by a
            licensee that is the holder of one or more licences in a group of licences,
            and

for a timber licence to which all or a part of the reduction referred to in
              paragraph
              (a) is attributed, may provide that the reduction is to be accomplished by
            means of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
a series of reductions occurring on different dates specified in an
              order.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
By one or more orders in writing, the minister must specify, for each of the
          timber licences referred to in subsection (1), the part of the area of Crown land
          described in the timber licence that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: remains after

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the reduction made by section 2 (2), and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
is deleted from the timber licence as a result of the reduction and
            attribution.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: By one or more orders in writing, the minister

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
must attribute a reduction of allowable annual cut under section 2 (3)
            in equal or unequal portions, specified in the order, to one or more of the licences in
            a group of licences, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
a series of reductions occurring on different dates specified in an
              order.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The allowable annual cut of a licence to which the minister attributes all or part
          of a reduction made under section 2 (3) is reduced by the amount attributed by the
          order to that licence.

By one or more orders in writing, the minister may specify, for each tree farm
          licence in a group of licences, the area of Crown land in the tree farm licence area
          that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: remains after the reduction made by subsection (3), or

is deleted from the tree farm licence area as a result of the
            reduction.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A minister's order under this section

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may be made or amended

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
on any date in the 3 years after March 31, 2003 if it is an order referred to
              in subsection
                (2),

on any date in the 5 years after March 31, 2003 if it is an order referred to
              in subsection
                (1) or (1.1), or
at any time, if it is an order referred to in subsection (4),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
may differ for different timber, places or transactions or for different
            licences or timber licences, and

may specify a date for subsection (5.1) that is subsequent to the date the
            order is made.

the date when a minister's order under this section is made, if no subsequent
            date is specified for this subsection under subsection (5) (c), or

the subsequent date, if one is specified for this subsection under subsection (5)
              (c),
is deemed to have come into force on March 31, 2003, and

is retroactive to the extent necessary to give it effect on and after March 31,
            2003.

bcl:text:
Written notice of an order under this section must be delivered to the holder of
          a
that is affected by the order.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: licence, or
timber licence

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The minister, by written notice, may require the holder of an ungrouped licence, a
          timber licence or a licence in a group of licences, at the holder's expense, to provide
          information that the minister considers necessary for the purposes of the orders referred
          to in section 3.

At the time and in the form and manner required by the minister, the holder of an
          ungrouped licence, a timber licence or a licence in a group of licences must provide the
          required information to the minister.

A holder of an ungrouped licence, a timber licence or a licence in a group of
          licences who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Deemed amendments to affected timber licences and other
        licences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An ungrouped licence referred to in section 2 (1) is deemed amended to
          reflect the reduction under section 2 (1).

A timber licence referred to in section 2 (2) is deemed amended to reflect the
          minister's orders under section 3 (1) and (1.1).

A licence referred to in section 2 (3) is deemed amended to reflect the
          minister's orders under section 3 (2) and (4).

Each holder of an ungrouped licence is entitled to compensation from the
          government for a reduction under section 2 (1) of the allowable annual cut of the
          ungrouped licence, in an amount equal to the value, for the unexpired portion of the term
          of the licence, of the harvesting rights taken by means of the reduction.

Each holder of a timber licence is entitled to compensation from the government in
          respect of the part, if any, of a reduction in the area of Crown land described in the
          timber licence that is made under section 2 (2) and that is attributed under section 3 (1)
          to that licence in an amount equal to the value of the harvesting rights taken by means of
          the reduction.

Each holder of a licence in a group of licences is entitled to compensation from
          the government in respect of the part, if any, of a reduction of the allowable annual cut
          of the licence that is made under section 2 (3) and that is attributed under section 3 (2)
          to that licence, in an amount equal to the value, for the unexpired portion of the term of
          the licence, of the harvesting rights taken by means of the reduction.

In addition to the compensation to which the holder of an ungrouped licence, a
          timber licence or a licence in a group of licences is entitled under subsection
            (1), 
            (2) or  (3), the holder is entitled to compensation from the government in an
          amount equal to the value of improvements made to Crown land that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: are, or have been, authorized by the government,

bcl:link.in:doc:
Forest Practices Code
                of British Columbia Act

bcl:text.#text: are not improvements to which section 174 of the  applies, and
are not, or have not been, paid for by the government under the  or the former Act as defined in the .

Subsection (4) also applies to a holder of a tree farm licence that is subject to
          a deletion of Crown land from the tree farm licence area under section 39.1 of the
            , if the deletion

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
is in respect of a reduction of allowable annual cut under section 3 (3)
            of this Act, and
is made before the date this subsection comes into force.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An entitlement to compensation under this section vests in the holder to which it
          applies on March 31, 2003.

bcl:text.#text:
A dispute between the minister and the holder of an ungrouped licence, a timber
          licence or a licence in a group of licences as to the amount of the compensation to which
          the holder is entitled under this section must be submitted to arbitration under the
            .
In this section,  includes damages.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The compensation to which the holder of an ungrouped licence, of a timber licence
          or of a licence in a group of licences, is entitled under section 6 is limited to the amount
          of compensation determined in relation to that licence under this Act.

bcl:text:
No action lies, and an action or other proceeding must not be brought or
          continued, against the government for compensation
in an amount that exceeds the amount limited under subsection (2).

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: arising out of this Act,
because of any of the things specified in or under this Act, or

because of any of the things specified in or under this Act in combination with
            any or all of the other things specified in or under this Act,

bcl:text.#text:
The  does not apply to a
          reduction under section 2 or 3 of this Act or to anything done under a minister's
          order referred to in section 3 of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
This Act must be applied to and must be given effect in every action or other
          proceeding whether commenced before, on or after March 31, 2003.

This Act must not be construed as lacking effect, whether retroactive or
          otherwise, in relation to any matter because it makes no specific reference to that
          matter.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
In the 2002-2003 fiscal year of the government, the minister is authorized to pay
        not more than $200 million out of the consolidated revenue fund for the purpose of providing
        compensation to which holders of ungrouped licences, of timber licences or of licences in a
        group of licences are entitled under section 6.

bcl:text.#text:
In this section,  refers to the
          trust

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
that has been created under that name by the deed of trust, dated for reference
            as of March 17, 2003, between Her Majesty the Queen in Right of the Province of British
            Columbia, as represented by the minister, and the Bank of Nova Scotia Trust Company, the
            initial trustee, which deed of trust sets out the terms and conditions of the BC
            Forestry Revitalization Trust, and

bcl:text.#text:
the purpose of which, under Part 2 of the deed of trust, is to mitigate adverse
            financial impacts suffered by any eligible person, as described in the deed of trust, as
            a result of restructuring of the forestry sector and forestry operations within British
            Columbia, arising out of reductions under the  of harvesting rights available to licensees
            under the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A true copy of the BC Forestry Revitalization Trust must be kept on file, and made
          available for public inspection without charge, in each regional office of the
          ministry.

bcl:text.#text:
For the purposes of section 24 of the , the BC Forestry Revitalization Trust is a trust for a specific
          noncharitable purpose that creates no enforceable equitable interest in a specific
          person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
In the 2002-2003 fiscal year of the government, the minister must pay $75 million
          out of the consolidated revenue fund to the BC Forestry Revitalization Trust.

bcl:marginalnote.in:doc:
Balanced Budget and Ministerial Accountability
        Act

bcl:link.in:doc:
Balanced Budget and
            Ministerial Accountability Act

bcl:text.#text:
For the purposes of sections 5 (1) and 6 (1) of the  in relation to the Minister of
        Forests for the 2002-2003 fiscal year, the estimated amount under section 6 (1) of
        that Act is the sum of the amounts appropriated

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
for the operating expenses for which that minister is responsible in the main
          estimates for that fiscal year, and
under sections 9 and 10 (4) of this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council, by regulation, may amend the Schedule

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
to correct, as necessary, the names of licensees itemized in Column 1 and the
          licence numbers itemized in Column 2, and

bcl:text: that affects the volume of timber

bcl:text.#text: of a licence under section 19 or 39 of the ,

a disposition, as defined in section 53 of the , of a licence as defined in section 1 of this Act, to or from
            a licensee named in the Schedule,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
an amalgamation of a corporation that is a licensee named in the Schedule
            with another corporation, or

bcl:text.#text:
a change of control, a disposition of control or an acquisition of control, all
            as set out in section 54.5 of the , involving a licensee named in the Schedule

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: set out in Column 3 of the Schedule for a group of licences, or

specified in any of the licences held by a licensee listed in Column 1 of the
              Schedule.

bcl:text.#text:
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section 41
          of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may
          make regulations

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: defining a word or expression not otherwise defined in this Act, and

for the purposes of section 6, prescribing respecting value, including but
            not limited to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: determining value and defining the components that comprise value,
prescribing methods of evaluation for use in determining value,
prescribing factors to be taken into account in an evaluation,

defining the role of evaluators in a determination of value and prescribing
              qualifications for evaluators that are prerequisite to their participation in the
              determination of value, and
prescribing requirements for the selection of arbitrators.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A regulation made under this Act may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
be made applicable generally or to a specific person, entity, thing or
            transaction, or class of persons, entities, things or transactions,

for the purpose of the regulation, define classes of timber licence holders and
            of licence holders, other persons or entities,

for the purpose of the regulation, define classes of things or transactions,
            and

provide differently for different persons, entities, things or transactions, or
            for different classes of persons, entities, things or transactions.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
In making a regulation under this Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council
          may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: delegate a matter to a person, and
confer a discretion on a person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Regulations under this section may be made retroactive to March 31, 2003 or to a
          later date the Lieutenant Governor in Council may specify by regulation and a regulation
          made retroactive in accordance with this subsection is deemed to have come into force on
          the date specified in the regulation.
